what: Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
title: Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
text: function combines species, food, environment data calculate input variables model. includes food mass ingested, dry matter influx, water balance components.

title: Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
text: species Data frame containing species physiological parameters. Must include: EnergyExp, TotalH2OTurnover, WVinLungs food Data frame containing food composition data. Must include: Digestibility, EEE, food macronutrient contents energies, elemental compositions (O H ratios), freeH20food environment Data frame containing environmental conditions

title: Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
text: Data frame input combinations calculated physiological variables: FoodMassIngested - Mass food consumed dryOinflux - Dry oxygen influx food dryHinflux - Dry hydrogen influx food FreeH2Oinfood - Free water content food WaterinFood - Water vapor food (half free water) DrinkingH2OIngested - Additional water intake required DrinkingWater - Drinking water vapor (half ingested)

title: Calculate input variables for model — Input_Function
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create example data species_data <- data.frame(   EnergyExp = 5000,   TotalH2OTurnover = 1000,   WVinLungs = 50 )  food_data <- data.frame(   Digestibility = 0.85,   EEE = 0.95,   foodcarbcontent = 0.6, foodcarbenergy = 17,   foodproteincontent = 0.25, foodproteinenergy = 23,   foodfatcontent = 0.05, foodfatenergy = 39,   Ocarb = 1.33, Oprotein = 1.41, Ofat = 2.9,   Hcarb = 1.51, Hprotein = 1.29, Hfat = 1.94,   freeH20food = 0.75 )  environment_data <- data.frame(   Temperature = 25,   Humidity = 60 )  result <- Input_Function(   species = species_data,   food = food_data,   environment = environment_data ) } # }

Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
text: function computes various physiological outputs related water balance, heat regulation, metabolic processes animals. calculates fecal outputs, water vapor losses different routes, metabolic byproducts based input parameters describing food intake, digestibility, water turnover.

title: Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
text: inputs data frame containing following required columns: FoodMassIngested Numeric. Mass food consumed (grams) Digestibility Numeric. Fraction food digested (0-1) TotalH2OTurnover Numeric. Total daily water turnover (ml) H2OOral Numeric. Oral water loss (ml) H2ONasal Numeric. Nasal water loss (ml) TranscutaneousH2OLoss Numeric. Transcutaneous water loss (ml) UrinaryH2OLoss Numeric. Urinary water loss (ml) Oprotein Numeric. Oxygen consumption protein metabolism foodproteincontent Numeric. Protein content food (fraction) EEE Numeric. Energy extraction efficiency (0-1) MolesO2Air Numeric. Moles oxygen air dryHinflux Numeric. Dry hydrogen influx dryOinflux Numeric. Dry oxygen influx sweating_species Logical. Indicates whether species capable sweating. TRUE, water vapor loss sweating calculated 75% water heat loss. FALSE (default), sweating water vapor loss set zero.

title: Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
text: data frame containing original input columns plus following calculated output columns: DryFecalOutput Numeric. Dry mass fecal output (grams) FecalH20Loss Numeric. Water loss feces (ml) WVFecal Numeric. Water vapor fecal loss (ml) WaterHeatLoss Numeric. Water used thermoregulation (ml) WVSweat Numeric. Water vapor sweating (ml, species-dependent) Panting Numeric. Water loss panting (ml) WVMouth Numeric. Water vapor oral routes (ml) UreaProduced Numeric. Urea production protein metabolism WVCO2 Numeric. Water vapor associated CO2 exchange

title: Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
text: function performs calculations specific sequence handle dependencies: Calculates dry fecal output based food intake digestibility Computes fecal water loss using standard conversion factors Determines water available heat loss subtracting losses Calculates sweating-related outputs (species-dependent) Computes respiratory water losses Determines metabolic outputs including urea production

title: Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
text: water-related inputs outputs use consistent units (typically ml). Digestibility efficiency values 0 1. non-sweating species, set sweating_species = FALSE (default).

title: Calculate Outputs for Animal — outputs_function
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example for a small mammal mouse_data <- data.frame(   FoodMassIngested = 5.2,   Digestibility = 0.85,   TotalH2OTurnover = 8.5,   H2OOral = 1.2,   H2ONasal = 0.8,   TranscutaneousH2OLoss = 2.1,   UrinaryH2OLoss = 3.2,   Oprotein = 0.12,   foodproteincontent = 0.18,   EEE = 0.88,   MolesO2Air = 0.42,   dryHinflux = 0.15,   dryOinflux = 0.08 )  # Calculate outputs for non-sweating species (default) mouse_outputs <- outputs_function(mouse_data)  # Calculate outputs for sweating species with debug info human_outputs <- outputs_function(human_data, sweating_species = TRUE, printinfo = TRUE)  # Multiple animals multi_animal_data <- data.frame(   FoodMassIngested = c(100, 150, 200),   Digestibility = c(0.8, 0.75, 0.85),   TotalH2OTurnover = c(1000, 1200, 1400),   H2OOral = c(50, 60, 70),   H2ONasal = c(20, 25, 30),   TranscutaneousH2OLoss = c(80, 90, 100),   UrinaryH2OLoss = c(150, 180, 200),   Oprotein = c(0.1, 0.12, 0.08),   foodproteincontent = c(0.2, 0.18, 0.22),   EEE = c(0.9, 0.85, 0.92),   MolesO2Air = c(10, 12, 8),   dryHinflux = c(4, 5, 3),   dryOinflux = c(2, 2.5, 1.5) ) multi_outputs <- outputs_function(multi_animal_data, sweating_species = FALSE) } # }
